page.title: 04The Village of Ryhope
page.content: The name{Ryhope}is Saxon. Over the years it has had several different spellings - Reohoffa, Rivehop, Reshop and Riopp. Its meaning is thought to be 'Raef's Rugged Valley' or 'the stream in the valley'. The original settlement is thought to date from{Saxon}times. In 1801 the population of{Ryhope}was 254, not much larger than it had been in earlier years. With the opening of the{Pit}in the last century there was a dramatic increase in the population. This was followed by the opening of the{Co-op in 1865. When{Cherry Knowle Hospital opened in 1893 there were three main employers in{Ryhope.}Since the closure of the{Pit}in 1966, followed by that of the{Co-op,}much of the pit village character has disappeared. Today most villagers work away from Ryhope and many face the problem of unemployment.
